qas.question: What is the main cause of HIV-1 infection in children?
qas.answers: Mother-to-child transmission (MTCT) is the main cause of HIV-1 infection in children worldwide.

qas.question: What plays the crucial role in the Mother to Child Transmission of HIV-1 and what increases the risk
qas.answers: DC-SIGNR plays a crucial role in MTCT of HIV-1 and that impaired placental DC-SIGNR expression increases risk of transmission.

qas.question: How many children were infected by HIV-1 in 2008-2009, worldwide?
qas.answers: more than 400,000 children were infected worldwide, mostly through MTCT and 90% of them lived in sub-Saharan Africa.
